text: {{Infobox writer | image = | imagesize = 200px | name = Terry Kay | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = Terry Winter Kay | birth_date = | birth_place = Royston, Georgia, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = Athens, Georgia, U.S. | occupation = novelist | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = Tommie Duncan Kay | partner = | children = Three | awards = Townsend Prize Georgia Author of the Year Southern Emmy Award Appalachian Heritage Writers Award | signature = | website = }} Terry Kay (February 10, 1938 - December 12, 2020) was an American author. Kay was known for his work as To Dance with the White Dog. Kay was born in Royston, Georgia. Kay died on December 12, 2020 from liver cancer in Athens, Georgia at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American novelists Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Writers from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Terry Kay
